      • createCircleFeature

        public static Feature createCircleFeature(LatLng center,
                                          java.lang.Float radius,
                                          java.lang.Float points)
                                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Creates a circle using a GeoJSON polygon. It's not strictly a circle but by increasing the number of sides on the polygon you can get pretty close to one.

        Adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37599561/drawing-a-circle-with-the-radius-in-miles-meters-with-mapbox-gl-js/39006388#39006388

        Parameters:
        center - - Coordinates for the center of the circle
        radius - - Radius of the circle in meters
        points - - Since this is a GeoJSON polygon, we need to have a large number of sides so that it gets as close as possible to being a circle
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        org.json.JSONException

      • isResidentialStructure

        Returns:

      • displayAddStructureOutOfBoundaryWarningDialog

        public static java.lang.Boolean displayAddStructureOutOfBoundaryWarningDialog()
        Uses the server setting "display_add_structure_out_of_boundary_warning_dialog" to determine whether to display the "Register structure outside area boundary" warning dialog

        If this variable is not available on the server the DEFAULT_DRAW_OPERATIONAL_AREA_BOUNDARY_AND_LABEL value from the constants file is used

        Returns:
        displayAddStructureOutOfBoundaryWarningDialog

      • getCoordsFromGeometry

        public static org.json.JSONArray getCoordsFromGeometry(Geometry updatedGeometry,
                                                       Geometry originalGeometry)
        This method takes in a geometry object and returns a JSONArray representation of the coordinates
        Parameters:
        updatedGeometry - The geometry of the updated feature
        originalGeometry - The geometry of the original feature used to determine whether it was a MultiPolygon or a Polygon
        Returns:
